purpose: To explain how proper incentive design aligns organization with TSR goals.
title: Proper incentive design aligns organization with TSR goals

bullets.text: As the old saying goes ...what gets measured and paid for gets done
Planning will be theoretical and often gamed if plan targets and resulting performance are not
Closely linked to near and long term incentives
Long term incentives should be market based, not internal objectives for improvement that do not clearly back to TSR
Base performance & competition on iTSR and other TSR linked metrics
Timing of incentive structure matters, with three year rolling a useful standard
Longer time horizon prevents short term manipulation and gaming
Multi year assessments work best with long tenured management teams
In mobile organizations, compensation tranches can follow executives who move from one business to another
Important to align incentives with levers managers, based on relevant level in organization
Also need to minimize asymmetries of risk by exposing executives to the same upside and downside risks that investors face- they should have skin in the game
